text: So I recently mentioned Dart/Flutter in a curious/positive light. After speaking with people who make android applications I was told just use Kotlin it's the industry standard. Also Flutter has a lot of that bleeding edge feel with it's ecosystem/documentation. I was hoping it was more of a "look we know you have to do this we tried to make it easy and stable as possible". Wasn't my experience - although super brief. Oh well

text: Dart is a pretty good JIT/AOT language for prototyping, and it compiles to Javascript so works for web too, but that's a little more experimental right now. It definitely has a lower footprint than electron, which is what most wrappers around basically a web browser use (slack, discord, etc. "desktop" apps). From what I understand, it can't be as nice as Kotlin for Android because it has to support both iOS and Android APIs, so it's a little lacking in notification support, etc. that differ too much across platforms. It's really meant to be a React Native competitor - and I think it does pretty well at that.
